name: iam
title: Google Identity and Access Management (IAM) API
description: Manages identity and access control for Google Cloud Platform resources, including the creation of service accounts, which you can use to authenticate to Google and make API calls.

parameters.name: prettyPrint
parameters.desc: Returns response with indentations and line breaks.

parameters.name: key
parameters.desc: API key. Your API key identifies your project and provides you with API access, quota, and reports. Required unless you provide an OAuth 2.0 token.

parameters.name: oauth_token
parameters.desc: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.desc: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.

parameters.name: quotaUser
parameters.desc: Available to use for quota purposes for server-side applications. Can be any arbitrary string assigned to a user, but should not exceed 40 characters.

schemas.name: AuditData
schemas.desc:
Audit log information specific to Cloud IAM. This message is serialized
as an `Any` type in the `ServiceData` message of an
`AuditLog` message.

fields.name: policyDelta
fields.desc: Policy delta between the original policy and the newly set policy.

schemas.name: PolicyDelta
schemas.desc: The difference delta between two policies.

fields.name: bindingDeltas
fields.desc: The delta for Bindings between two policies.

schemas.name: ListServiceAccountsResponse
schemas.desc: The service account list response.

fields.name: nextPageToken
fields.desc:
To retrieve the next page of results, set
ListServiceAccountsRequest.page_token
to this value.

fields.name: accounts
fields.desc: The list of matching service accounts.

schemas.name: SignBlobRequest
schemas.desc: The service account sign blob request.

fields.name: bytesToSign
fields.desc: The bytes to sign.

schemas.name: SetIamPolicyRequest
schemas.desc: Request message for `SetIamPolicy` method.

fields.name: policy
fields.desc:
REQUIRED: The complete policy to be applied to the `resource`. The size of
the policy is limited to a few 10s of KB. An empty policy is a
valid policy but certain Cloud Platform services (such as Projects)
might reject them.

schemas.name: TestIamPermissionsResponse
schemas.desc: Response message for `TestIamPermissions` method.

fields.name: permissions
fields.desc:
A subset of `TestPermissionsRequest.permissions` that the caller is
allowed.

schemas.name: ListServiceAccountKeysResponse
schemas.desc: The service account keys list response.

fields.name: keys
fields.desc: The public keys for the service account.

schemas.name: ServiceAccountKey
schemas.desc:
Represents a service account key.

A service account has two sets of key-pairs: user-managed, and
system-managed.

User-managed key-pairs can be created and deleted by users.  Users are
responsible for rotating these keys periodically to ensure security of
their service accounts.  Users retain the private key of these key-pairs,
and Google retains ONLY the public key.

System-managed key-pairs are managed automatically by Google, and rotated
daily without user intervention.  The private key never leaves Google's
servers to maximize security.

Public keys for all service accounts are also published at the OAuth2
Service Account API.

fields.name: validAfterTime
fields.desc: The key can be used after this timestamp.

fields.name: privateKeyData
fields.desc:
The private key data. Only provided in `CreateServiceAccountKey`
responses.

fields.name: publicKeyData
fields.desc: The public key data. Only provided in `GetServiceAccountKey` responses.

fields.name: name
fields.desc:
The resource name of the service account key in the following format
`projects/{PROJECT_ID}/serviceAccounts/{SERVICE_ACCOUNT_EMAIL}/keys/{key}`.

fields.name: validBeforeTime
fields.desc: The key can be used before this timestamp.

fields.name: keyAlgorithm
fields.desc: Specifies the algorithm (and possibly key size) for the key.

fields.name: privateKeyType
fields.desc:
The output format for the private key.
Only provided in `CreateServiceAccountKey` responses, not
in `GetServiceAccountKey` or `ListServiceAccountKey` responses.

Google never exposes system-managed private keys, and never retains
user-managed private keys.

enum.name: TYPE_PKCS12_FILE
enum.desc:
PKCS12 format.
The password for the PKCS12 file is `notasecret`.
For more information, see https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7292.

schemas.name: Policy

fields.name: etag
fields.desc:
`etag` is used for optimistic concurrency control as a way to help
prevent simultaneous updates of a policy from overwriting each other.
It is strongly suggested that systems make use of the `etag` in the
read-modify-write cycle to perform policy updates in order to avoid race
conditions: An `etag` is returned in the response to `getIamPolicy`, and
systems are expected to put that etag in the request to `setIamPolicy` to
ensure that their change will be applied to the same version of the policy.

If no `etag` is provided in the call to `setIamPolicy`, then the existing
policy is overwritten blindly.

fields.name: version
fields.desc: Version of the `Policy`. The default version is 0.

fields.name: bindings
fields.desc:
Associates a list of `members` to a `role`.
Multiple `bindings` must not be specified for the same `role`.
`bindings` with no members will result in an error.

schemas.name: BindingDelta
schemas.desc:
One delta entry for Binding. Each individual change (only one member in each
entry) to a binding will be a separate entry.

fields.name: member
fields.desc:
A single identity requesting access for a Cloud Platform resource.
Follows the same format of Binding.members.
Required

fields.name: role
fields.desc:
Role that is assigned to `members`.
For example, `roles/viewer`, `roles/editor`, or `roles/owner`.
Required

fields.name: action
fields.desc:
The action that was performed on a Binding.
Required

schemas.name: QueryGrantableRolesRequest
schemas.desc: The grantable role query request.

fields.name: fullResourceName
fields.desc:
Required. The full resource name to query from the list of grantable roles.

The name follows the Google Cloud Platform resource format.
For example, a Cloud Platform project with id `my-project` will be named
`//cloudresourcemanager.googleapis.com/projects/my-project`.

schemas.name: QueryGrantableRolesResponse
schemas.desc: The grantable role query response.

fields.name: roles
fields.desc: The list of matching roles.

schemas.name: Role
schemas.desc: A role in the Identity and Access Management API.

fields.name: name
fields.desc:
The name of the role.

When Role is used in CreateRole, the role name must not be set.

When Role is used in output and other input such as UpdateRole, the role
name is the complete path, e.g., roles/logging.viewer for curated roles
and organizations/{ORGANIZATION_ID}/roles/logging.viewer for custom roles.

fields.name: description
fields.desc: Optional.  A human-readable description for the role.

fields.name: title
fields.desc:
Optional.  A human-readable title for the role.  Typically this
is limited to 100 UTF-8 bytes.

schemas.name: Binding
schemas.desc: Associates `members` with a `role`.

fields.name: members
fields.desc:
Specifies the identities requesting access for a Cloud Platform resource.
`members` can have the following values:

* `allUsers`: A special identifier that represents anyone who is
   on the internet; with or without a Google account.

* `allAuthenticatedUsers`: A special identifier that represents anyone
   who is authenticated with a Google account or a service account.

* `user:{emailid}`: An email address that represents a specific Google
   account. For example, `alice@gmail.com` or `joe@example.com`.


* `serviceAccount:{emailid}`: An email address that represents a service
   account. For example, `my-other-app@appspot.gserviceaccount.com`.

* `group:{emailid}`: An email address that represents a Google group.
   For example, `admins@example.com`.

* `domain:{domain}`: A Google Apps domain name that represents all the
   users of that domain. For example, `google.com` or `example.com`.

fields.name: role
fields.desc:
Role that is assigned to `members`.
For example, `roles/viewer`, `roles/editor`, or `roles/owner`.
Required

schemas.name: ServiceAccount
schemas.desc:
A service account in the Identity and Access Management API.

To create a service account, specify the `project_id` and the `account_id`
for the account.  The `account_id` is unique within the project, and is used
to generate the service account email address and a stable
`unique_id`.

If the account already exists, the account's resource name is returned
in util::Status's ResourceInfo.resource_name in the format of
projects/{PROJECT_ID}/serviceAccounts/{SERVICE_ACCOUNT_EMAIL}. The caller can
use the name in other methods to access the account.

All other methods can identify the service account using the format
`projects/{PROJECT_ID}/serviceAccounts/{SERVICE_ACCOUNT_EMAIL}`.
Using `-` as a wildcard for the project will infer the project from
the account. The `account` value can be the `email` address or the
`unique_id` of the service account.

fields.name: name
fields.desc:
The resource name of the service account in the following format:
`projects/{PROJECT_ID}/serviceAccounts/{SERVICE_ACCOUNT_EMAIL}`.

Requests using `-` as a wildcard for the project will infer the project
from the `account` and the `account` value can be the `email` address or
the `unique_id` of the service account.

In responses the resource name will always be in the format
`projects/{PROJECT_ID}/serviceAccounts/{SERVICE_ACCOUNT_EMAIL}`.

fields.name: email
fields.desc: @OutputOnly The email address of the service account.

fields.name: projectId
fields.desc: @OutputOnly The id of the project that owns the service account.

fields.name: oauth2ClientId
uniqueId
fields.desc: @OutputOnly The unique and stable id of the service account.

fields.name: displayName
fields.desc:
Optional. A user-specified description of the service account.  Must be
fewer than 100 UTF-8 bytes.

fields.name: etag
fields.desc: Used to perform a consistent read-modify-write.

schemas.name: Empty
TestIamPermissionsRequest
schemas.desc: Request message for `TestIamPermissions` method.

fields.name: permissions
fields.desc:
The set of permissions to check for the `resource`. Permissions with
wildcards (such as '*' or 'storage.*') are not allowed. For more
information see
[IAM Overview](https://cloud.google.com/iam/docs/overview#permissions).

schemas.name: SignBlobResponse
schemas.desc: The service account sign blob response.

fields.name: keyId
fields.desc: The id of the key used to sign the blob.

fields.name: signature
fields.desc: The signed blob.

schemas.name: SignJwtResponse
schemas.desc: The service account sign JWT response.

fields.name: keyId
fields.desc: The id of the key used to sign the JWT.

fields.name: signedJwt
fields.desc: The signed JWT.

schemas.name: CreateServiceAccountRequest
schemas.desc: The service account create request.

fields.name: serviceAccount
fields.desc:
The ServiceAccount resource to create.
Currently, only the following values are user assignable:
`display_name` .

fields.name: accountId
fields.desc:
Required. The account id that is used to generate the service account
email address and a stable unique id. It is unique within a project,
must be 6-30 characters long, and match the regular expression
`[a-z]([-a-z0-9]*[a-z0-9])` to comply with RFC1035.

schemas.name: CreateServiceAccountKeyRequest
schemas.desc: The service account key create request.

fields.name: keyAlgorithm
fields.desc:
Which type of key and algorithm to use for the key.
The default is currently a 2K RSA key.  However this may change in the
future.

fields.name: privateKeyType
fields.desc:
The output format of the private key. `GOOGLE_CREDENTIALS_FILE` is the
default output format.

enum.name: TYPE_PKCS12_FILE
enum.desc:
PKCS12 format.
The password for the PKCS12 file is `notasecret`.
For more information, see https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7292.

schemas.name: SignJwtRequest
schemas.desc: The service account sign JWT request.

fields.name: payload
fields.desc: The JWT payload to sign, a JSON JWT Claim set.

methods.name: queryGrantableRoles
methods.desc:
Queries roles that can be granted on a particular resource.
A role is grantable if it can be used as the role in a binding for a policy
for that resource.

pathParams.name: name
pathParams.desc:
The resource name of the service account in the following format:
`projects/{PROJECT_ID}/serviceAccounts/{SERVICE_ACCOUNT_EMAIL}`.
Using `-` as a wildcard for the project will infer the project from
the account. The `account` value can be the `email` address or the
`unique_id` of the service account.

methods.name: update
methods.desc:
Updates a ServiceAccount.

Currently, only the following fields are updatable:
`display_name` .
The `etag` is mandatory.

pathParams.name: name
pathParams.desc:
The resource name of the service account in the following format:
`projects/{PROJECT_ID}/serviceAccounts/{SERVICE_ACCOUNT_EMAIL}`.

Requests using `-` as a wildcard for the project will infer the project
from the `account` and the `account` value can be the `email` address or
the `unique_id` of the service account.

In responses the resource name will always be in the format
`projects/{PROJECT_ID}/serviceAccounts/{SERVICE_ACCOUNT_EMAIL}`.

methods.name: signJwt
methods.desc:
Signs a JWT using a service account's system-managed private key.

If no expiry time (`exp`) is provided in the `SignJwtRequest`, IAM sets an
an expiry time of one hour by default. If you request an expiry time of
more than one hour, the request will fail.

pathParams.name: name
pathParams.desc:
The resource name of the service account in the following format:
`projects/{PROJECT_ID}/serviceAccounts/{SERVICE_ACCOUNT_EMAIL}`.
Using `-` as a wildcard for the project will infer the project from
the account. The `account` value can be the `email` address or the
`unique_id` of the service account.

methods.name: create
methods.desc:
Creates a ServiceAccount
and returns it.

pathParams.name: name
pathParams.desc:
Required. The resource name of the project associated with the service
accounts, such as `projects/my-project-123`.

methods.name: getIamPolicy
methods.desc:
Returns the IAM access control policy for a
ServiceAccount.

pathParams.name: resource
pathParams.desc:
REQUIRED: The resource for which the policy is being requested.
`resource` is usually specified as a path. For example, a Project
resource is specified as `projects/{project}`.

methods.name: testIamPermissions
methods.desc:
Tests the specified permissions against the IAM access control policy
for a ServiceAccount.

pathParams.name: resource
pathParams.desc:
REQUIRED: The resource for which the policy detail is being requested.
`resource` is usually specified as a path. For example, a Project
resource is specified as `projects/{project}`.

pathParams.name: name
pathParams.desc:
The resource name of the service account in the following format:
`projects/{PROJECT_ID}/serviceAccounts/{SERVICE_ACCOUNT_EMAIL}`.
Using `-` as a wildcard for the project will infer the project from
the account. The `account` value can be the `email` address or the
`unique_id` of the service account.

methods.name: signBlob
methods.desc: Signs a blob using a service account's system-managed private key.

pathParams.name: name
pathParams.desc:
The resource name of the service account in the following format:
`projects/{PROJECT_ID}/serviceAccounts/{SERVICE_ACCOUNT_EMAIL}`.
Using `-` as a wildcard for the project will infer the project from
the account. The `account` value can be the `email` address or the
`unique_id` of the service account.

pathParams.name: name
pathParams.desc:
Required. The resource name of the project associated with the service
accounts, such as `projects/my-project-123`.

optinalQueryParams.name: pageToken
optinalQueryParams.desc:
Optional pagination token returned in an earlier
ListServiceAccountsResponse.next_page_token.

optinalQueryParams.name: pageSize
optinalQueryParams.desc:
Optional limit on the number of service accounts to include in the
response. Further accounts can subsequently be obtained by including the
ListServiceAccountsResponse.next_page_token
in a subsequent request.

methods.name: setIamPolicy
methods.desc:
Sets the IAM access control policy for a
ServiceAccount.

pathParams.name: resource
pathParams.desc:
REQUIRED: The resource for which the policy is being specified.
`resource` is usually specified as a path. For example, a Project
resource is specified as `projects/{project}`.

pathParams.name: name
pathParams.desc:
The resource name of the service account in the following format:
`projects/{PROJECT_ID}/serviceAccounts/{SERVICE_ACCOUNT_EMAIL}`.

Using `-` as a wildcard for the project, will infer the project from
the account. The `account` value can be the `email` address or the
`unique_id` of the service account.

optinalQueryParams.name: keyTypes
optinalQueryParams.desc:
Filters the types of keys the user wants to include in the list
response. Duplicate key types are not allowed. If no key type
is provided, all keys are returned.

methods.name: get
methods.desc:
Gets the ServiceAccountKey
by key id.

pathParams.name: name
pathParams.desc:
The resource name of the service account key in the following format:
`projects/{PROJECT_ID}/serviceAccounts/{SERVICE_ACCOUNT_EMAIL}/keys/{key}`.

Using `-` as a wildcard for the project will infer the project from
the account. The `account` value can be the `email` address or the
`unique_id` of the service account.

optinalQueryParams.name: publicKeyType
optinalQueryParams.desc:
The output format of the public key requested.
X509_PEM is the default output format.

methods.name: create
methods.desc:
Creates a ServiceAccountKey
and returns it.

pathParams.name: name
pathParams.desc:
The resource name of the service account in the following format:
`projects/{PROJECT_ID}/serviceAccounts/{SERVICE_ACCOUNT_EMAIL}`.
Using `-` as a wildcard for the project will infer the project from
the account. The `account` value can be the `email` address or the
`unique_id` of the service account.

pathParams.name: name
pathParams.desc:
The resource name of the service account key in the following format:
`projects/{PROJECT_ID}/serviceAccounts/{SERVICE_ACCOUNT_EMAIL}/keys/{key}`.
Using `-` as a wildcard for the project will infer the project from
the account. The `account` value can be the `email` address or the
`unique_id` of the service account.
